content.description:
Pitch 1 : Steep bulge an traverse to the left at the start of a sike.(10c, 20m)

Pitch 2 : Amazing climbing on a dyke, short pitch (10b, 15m)

Pitch 3 : More dyke climbing bring you to a crack and a small roof. Belay on a ledge, then scramble 50 meter up and walk 200m right to a big boulder under a steep corner crack Â (10c, 25m)

Pitch 4 : Beautiful corner crack wide hand to finger, tree belay on a ledge (5.8, 20m)

Pitch 5 : Slab climb to a crak, tree belay (5.11a, 15m) hike 100m to the right

Pitch 6 : Pick your line up the 3 bolted routes and enjoy the few from the First peak (middle line is 10a, easiest)



The start of the climb is located just where switchback of the second peak gully are the closest from the wall, 2 bolt on a bulge,

8 draws and SR to 3
South facing slab at the back of the First peak
